line_1: Left playful Hours from steady Virtue swerve;
line_2: With jealous Eyes the while their Steps observe,

line_1: When wanton Souls from steddy Vertue swerve.
line_2: Such Scorn we may expect, nay we deserve,

line_1: From the nice Rules of Honour none should swerve;
line_2: Done because good, without a mean reserve.

line_1: Mysterious nature's laws that never swerve,
line_2: To sanctify the space you now observe.

line_1: And wisdom short of infinite may swerve.
line_2: Who acts by force impell'd, can nought deserve;
